alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Inland; Conecuh; Escambia; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 2:15PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Monroe, northern Baldwin, northwestern Escambia and southwestern Conecuh Counties through 245 PM CST... At 215 PM CST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Uriah, or 17 miles southwest of Frisco City, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... McCullough, Uriah, Castleberry, Repton and I65 And AL 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama.
